page.topic: Adding a Button-List to a ControlBar
page.description: A common pattern in mobile apps is to have a button bar at the bottom of the screen with a series of buttons that allow you to select the active Panel that is shown on the device. Typically, these buttons are spread out so that they fill the width of the screen. The button-list control is ideal for implementing this pattern.

section.description: To see how a Button-List can be configured to fill the width of the screen, and to select a Panel Card in a Panel Layout when one of the buttons in the Button-List is tapped, watch this three part video: [Part 1], [Part 2], [Part 3]. You can also follow the guide below.

section.title: Create a Panel Navigator with Panel Cards and a ControlBar

step.description: In the UX Builder open the Properties page. In the UX Properties section click the [...] button next to the 'Style name' property.
In the 'Location' menu select 'System' and then choose the 'Alpha' style. Click OK
Open the UX Controls page and check the 'Mobile' checkbox.
Open the 'Panels' menu. Select the [Panel Navigator] option to add a Panel Navigator to the component.
Highlight the Panel Navigator. In the properties list, on the right, change the 'Navigator type' property to 'Programmatic'.
Open the Panels menu again and click on [Panel Card] to add a Panel Card to the Panel Navigator. Name this panel 'PANELCARD_HOME'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_HOME]. Click on the [Panel Card] option again to add a second panel card to the component. Name this panel card 'PANELCARD_CHARTS'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_CHARTS]. Add a third panel card to the component. Name this panel card 'PANELCARD_SETTINGS'.
Highlight PANELCARD_HOME. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on the [Static Text] option to add a static text control to PANELCARD_HOME.
Highlight the static text property. In the Static Text Properties section on the right change the 'Static text' property to read 'This is the Home Panel'.
Highlight PANELCARD_CHARTS. Click on [Static Text] again to add a static text control to PANELCARD_CHARTS. Set the 'Static text' property to read 'This is the Charts Panel'
Highlight PANELCARD_SETTINGS. Add a [Static Text] control to this panel card and set the 'Static text' to read 'This is the Settings Panel'.
Highlight [Panel Card End: PANELCARD_SETTINGS]. Open the Containers menu and click the [Container] option.
From the Container Type list select the 'PanelFooter' option and click 'Insert After'.
Highlight the Panel Footer and open the 'Other Controls' menu. Select the [ControlBar] option to add a ControlBar to the Panel Footer.

section.title: Add a Button-list to the ControlBar

step.description: Highlight the ControlBar. In the properties list on the right click the [...] button next to the 'ControlBar properties' property to open the ControlBar Builder.
In the ControlBar Builder open the 'Items' pane. Click the 'Add ControlBar Item' button.
From the 'Item Type' list check the 'button-list' radio button and click OK.
Highlight the button-list item in the ControlBar Item Name menu. Scroll down the properties list on the right to the Button Settings section. Change the 'Button layout' property to be 'Image only'.
In the Button-List Settings section click the [...] button next to the 'Button-list Settings' property.
Click the 'Add Button' button in the Button-List Builder.
Set the HTML: for this button to be Panel1
Click the [...] button next to 'Icon:'
Click the 'SVG Icon' option and click Select
Select the 'Home' icon. This can be done by typing 'home' into the filter. Click OK and OK again.
Set the Value: of this button to be 'Home' and click OK.
step.note: These built-in icons are visible when the 'Style name' property on the properties page is set to 'Alpha'.

step.description: Click The Add Button again.
Set HTML: to be Panel2 and then Click the [...] button next to 'Icon'
Click the 'SVG Icon' option again and hit 'Select'. For this panel choose a 'Chart' icon, then click OK and OK again.
Set the value for the second button to be 'Charts' and click OK.
Click the 'Add Button' button a third time. Set the HTML for this button to be 'Panel3'.
Click the [...] button next to Panel3's Icon setting. Select the 'SVG Icon' and click 'Select'.
Choose the 'Settings' icon from the built-in SVG icons. Click OK and OK again.
Set the value of this button to be 'Settings'. Click OK.

step.description: Open the 'Items' pane again. Highlight the Buttonlist item and click the [...] button next tp the 'Click' action. This should be under the Item Actions section of the properties list.
Select the SetPanel action that you just defined.
Open the 'ControlBar Layout' pane. Click the Add Layout button. Give the layout a name, like 'Layout1' and click OK.
With the layout highlighted click the 'Add Line' button
In the Edit Layout Line dialog click the 'Add' button under the middle section. Select Buttonlist1 and click OK and OK again.
Click OK to close the ControlBar Builder and run the component in Live Preview.
